page.title: 08History in Farcet
page.content: We walked round{Farcet}with a lady who had lived there all her life. She showed us an estate of houses where there had been farm land and a{Manor {House.}The house was knocked down in 1618. The old{River Nene}used to flow near{Farcet.}The new course of the river was made in 1900. The old river is called the{Pig Water.}The old village was grouped around the church. There was a pond which has now been filled in. There was a big fire in 1921 and water from the pond was used to put it out. Many of the houses were built around 1900 when many people came to work in the brick yards. The first school was built in 1848. Now there is a new school and the old school is used for business premises.
